intro: Utricularia tenuis, commonly known as the slender bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is a small, aquatic or semi-aquatic plant that thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments. The plant is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures called utricles, which trap and digest small aquatic organisms. Utricularia tenuis typically grows in dense mats on the surface of water or submerged in shallow pools. Its delicate appearance and unique trapping mechanism make it an interesting subject for both botanical study and ecological research.
